title: When will 4k be supported? Really disappointed
body: So I upgraded my monitor to 4k and realized that league looks awful. The champ/minion health bar is tiny, so are the icons on the minimap, and my cursor is so small like it's almost impossible to play. It really is unplayable. I was wondering when 4k will be fully supported because its been so long and I've seen other people talk about this years ago. So many other games have 4k support and I think it's about time for league to support it too since this is pretty much just a scaling issue and should be easily fixed.

replies.body:
As of patch 7.24, the scaling for health bars was fixed for 4K. Also, hope this helps.
> [{quoted}](name=Rayven,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=V4Nhd4GJ,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-12-06T20:11:09.867+0000)
>
> What I can commit to is looking into it. Converting the healthbars over into new tech allowed us to make them support 4k. Cursors and minimap icons and some other less important UI bits are still way too small as you noted.
> 
> Converting those other elements is not simple and not something we would want to take on, but there might be a stopgap solution which just allows them to scale.

4k isn't fully supported yet since most of the player base hasn't switch over to 4k monitors. I'm not very well acquainted with 4k monitors myself, but I'm sure our techs would be able to get things running smoothly for you in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).
